title: Authors and Citation
text: Jared Andrews. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrews J (2024). dittoVizModules: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules dittoViz Plots. R package version 0.99.0.9000, https://github.com/j-andrews7/dittoVizModules, https://j-andrews7.github.io/dittoVizModules/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dittoVizModules: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules For dittoViz Plots},   author = {Jared Andrews},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.99.0.9000, https://github.com/j-andrews7/dittoVizModules},   url = {https://j-andrews7.github.io/dittoVizModules/}, }

what: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules For dittoViz Plots
title: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules For dittoViz Plots
text: package utilizes dittoViz package create interactivity-first Shiny modules common plot types, designed serve building blocks Shiny apps basis complex/specialized modules. modules contain possible functionality dittoViz additional parameters make use interactive features plotly, e.g. interactive text annotations, arbitrary shape annotations, multiple download formats, etc. modules provide comprehensive plot control app users, allowing convenient aesthetic customizations publication-quality images. also provide developers way dramatically save time reduce complexity plotting code flexible base build specialized Shiny modules upon.

title: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules For dittoViz Plots
text: Note package development may break time. Currently, package can installed Github:

title: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules For dittoViz Plots
text: Including dittoVizModules module Shiny application simple. package provides function returning example Shiny application module showcases functionality can used. example, can look createScatterPlotApp() function:
code: library(dittoVizModules)  createScatterPlotApp <- function(data_list) {     # Validate input     stopifnot(is.list(data_list))     lapply(data_list, function(data) {         stopifnot(is.data.frame(data))     })      # UI definition     ui <- fluidPage(         useShinyjs(),         titlePanel("Modular scatterPlots"),         sidebarLayout(             sidebarPanel(                 scatterPlotInputsUI("iris", data_list[["iris"]],                     title = h3("iris Settings"),                     defaults = list("x.by" = "Petal.Width")                 ),                 hr(),                 scatterPlotInputsUI("mtcars", data_list[["mtcars"]],                     title = h3("mtcars Settings"),                     defaults = list("y.by" = "vs")                 )             ),             mainPanel(                 tagList(scatterPlotOutputUI("iris"), br(), scatterPlotOutputUI("mtcars"))             )         )     )      # Server function     server <- function(input, output, session) {         lapply(names(data_list), function(name) {             scatterPlotServer(name, data = reactive(data_list[[name]]))         })     }      # Return the Shiny app     shinyApp(ui, server) }  data_list <- list("mtcars" = mtcars, "iris" = iris) createScatterPlotApp(data_list)

title: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules For dittoViz Plots
text: Currently, dittoVizModules contains functional Shiny module following dittoViz visualization functions: scatterPlot - x/y coordinate plots additional color shape encodings.

title: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules For dittoViz Plots
text: package based dittoViz modules developed plot types generated package, including: yPlot - box/violin/jitter plots. scatterHex - hexbin plots encoding density/frequency information along x/y coordinates. barPlot - compositional barplots. freqPlot - box/jitter plots discrete observation frequencies per sample/group. dittoViz active development, additional modules created visualization functions added.

title: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules For dittoViz Plots
text: contribute new module package, three files detailing components & usage module must added. Using scatterPlot module example: module UI - inputs outputs defined. inputs outputs defined function (scatterPlot_module_UI.R). module server function - server logic defined (scatterPlot_module_server.R). function generate basic example application using module (scatterPlot_module_app.R). function fully documented, outputs plotly plots, default values UI inputs able provided via named list, UI inputs hideable. addition, tooltips matching dittoViz parameter documentation (necessary associated edits account input type) used input. Inputs supporting new functionality also descriptive tooltips indicating modify plot. See scatterPlot module things can easily accomplished.

title: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules For dittoViz Plots
text: Certain dittoViz parameters easily adjusted via interactive features plotly, e.g. axis labels, plot title, etc. , inputs features need provided long reason exclusion included documentation module inputs UI function.

title: Flexible, Interactive Shiny Modules For dittoViz Plots
text: times, functionality geoms just can’t done plotly, e.g. interactive ridgeplots available dittoViz::yPlot(). missing broken functionality clearly indicated module inputs UI function documentation. Inputs generated non-functional/broken parameters.

what: Parse a string indicating a set of vectors to a list of vectors. — .string_to_list_of_vectors

text: Used parse text inputs list vectors.

title: Parse a string indicating a set of vectors to a list of vectors. — .string_to_list_of_vectors
Parse a string indicating a set of vectors to a list of vectors. — .string_to_list_of_vectors
text: x string indicating set vectors, e.g. ", b, c, d, e". contain internal quotes around elements.

title: Parse a string indicating a set of vectors to a list of vectors. — .string_to_list_of_vectors
text: list like list(c("", "b", "c"), c("d", "e")). input "", just returns "". input NULL, returns NULL.

title: Parse a string indicating a set of vectors to a list of vectors. — .string_to_list_of_vectors
text: Jared Andrews

what: Organize arbitrary Shiny inputs into a grid layout — organize_inputs
title: Organize arbitrary Shiny inputs into a grid layout — organize_inputs
text: Organize arbitrary Shiny inputs grid layout

title: Organize arbitrary Shiny inputs into a grid layout — organize_inputs
code: organize_inputs(   tag.list,   id = NULL,   title = NULL,   tack = NULL,   columns = NULL,   rows = NULL )

title: Organize arbitrary Shiny inputs into a grid layout — organize_inputs
text: tag.list tagList containing UI inputs named list containing multiple tagLists containing UI inputs. id optional ID tabsetPanel named list provided. title optional title grid, UI element, e.g. h3("Title"). tack optional UI input tack onto end grid. columns Number columns. rows Number rows.

title: Organize arbitrary Shiny inputs into a grid layout — organize_inputs
text: Shiny tagList inputs organized grid, optionally nested inside tabsetPanel.

title: Organize arbitrary Shiny inputs into a grid layout — organize_inputs
text: Jared Andrews

title: Organize arbitrary Shiny inputs into a grid layout — organize_inputs
code: library(dittoVizModules) # Example 1: Basic usage with a simple grid ui.inputs <- tagList(     textInput("name", "Name"),     numericInput("age", "Age", value = 30),     selectInput("gender", "Gender", choices = c("Male", "Female", "Other")) ) #> Error in tagList(textInput("name", "Name"), numericInput("age", "Age",     value = 30), selectInput("gender", "Gender", choices = c("Male",     "Female", "Other"))): could not find function "tagList" organize_inputs(ui.inputs, columns = 2, rows = 2) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'ui.inputs' not found  # Example 2: Using a named list to create tabs ui.inputs.tabs <- list(     Personal = tagList(         textInput("firstname", "First Name"),         textInput("lastname", "Last Name")     ),     Settings = tagList(         checkboxInput("newsletter", "Subscribe to newsletter", value = TRUE),         sliderInput("volume", "Volume", min = 0, max = 100, value = 50)     ) ) #> Error in tagList(textInput("firstname", "First Name"), textInput("lastname",     "Last Name")): could not find function "tagList" organize_inputs(ui.inputs.tabs) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'ui.inputs.tabs' not found  # Example 3: Adding an additional UI element with 'tack' additional.ui <- actionButton("submit", "Submit") #> Error in actionButton("submit", "Submit"): could not find function "actionButton" organize_inputs(ui.inputs, tack = additional.ui, columns = 3) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'ui.inputs' not found  # Example 4: Handling a case with more inputs than grid cells many.inputs <- tagList(replicate(10, textInput("input", "Input"))) #> Error in tagList(replicate(10, textInput("input", "Input"))): could not find function "tagList" organize_inputs(many.inputs, columns = 3) # Creates more than one row #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'many.inputs' not found

title: Input UI components for the scatterPlot module — scatterPlotInputsUI
code: scatterPlotInputsUI(id, data, defaults = NULL, title = NULL, columns = 2)

title: Input UI components for the scatterPlot module — scatterPlotInputsUI
text: id ID Shiny module. data data frame used plot generation. defaults named list default values inputs. title optional title UI grid. columns Number columns UI grid.

title: Input UI components for the scatterPlot module — scatterPlotInputsUI
text: Shiny tagList containing UI elements

title: Input UI components for the scatterPlot module — scatterPlotInputsUI
text: user inputs module separated outputs allow flexible UI design. inputs automatically organized grid layout via organize_inputs() function, columns controlling number columns grid. Defaults can set input providing named list values defaults argument. Nearly parameters dittoViz::scatterPlot() can set via inputs, see help function exhaustive list. Note parameters may input types differ actual function, e.g. shape.panel text input comma-separated integers, function expects vector integers. module parse inputs appropriate format dittoViz::scatterPlot() automatically. also handful specific Shiny module additionally modify plotly output: id: ID Shiny module.

title: Input UI components for the scatterPlot module — scatterPlotInputsUI
text: Jared Andrews
